schemeValue.name: PreAllocation
schemeValue.paragraph: An indication that the swap is to be allocated.

schemeValue.name: PostAllocation
schemeValue.paragraph: An indication that the swap has been allocated.

schemeValue.name: Unallocated
schemeValue.paragraph: An indication that the swap has not been allocated.

schemeValue.name: Credit
schemeValue.paragraph: Credit.

schemeValue.name: InterestRate
schemeValue.paragraph: InterestRate.

schemeValue.name: ForeignExchange
schemeValue.paragraph: ForeignExchange.

schemeValue.name: Equity
schemeValue.paragraph: Equity.

schemeValue.name: Commodity
schemeValue.paragraph: Commodity.

schemeValue.name: NPV
schemeValue.paragraph: Net Present Value = sum of present values of all cash flows; excludes cash flows paid or received on the valution date.

schemeValue.name: PriorNPV
schemeValue.paragraph: Net Present Value for prior day/processing run = sum of present values of all cash flows; excludes cash flows paid or received on the valution date.

schemeValue.name: NPVLocalCurrency
schemeValue.paragraph: NPV in the trade currency.

schemeValue.name: Cash
schemeValue.paragraph: A monetary amount paid or received. For example, a monetary amount payable on the valuation date, or a monetary amount payable on another specified date, such as a payment date.

schemeValue.name: Premium
schemeValue.paragraph: A fee paid or received to purchase a contract (usually an option).

schemeValue.name: FixedRate
schemeValue.paragraph: A numerical rate (usually an interest or FX rate) that is used to price a derivative.

schemeValue.name: FixedPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: A numerical price (usually a stock or bond price or a commodity price) that is used to price a derivative.

schemeValue.name: PayNPV
schemeValue.paragraph: NPV of cash flows for which the base counterparty pays.

schemeValue.name: ReceiveNPV
schemeValue.paragraph: NPV of cash flows for which the base counterparty receives.

schemeValue.name: VariationMargin
schemeValue.paragraph: Amount required to be posted to accommodate change in net value of trade or portfolio.

schemeValue.name: PAI
schemeValue.paragraph: Price adjustment interest ... the amount of interest owing on the NPV over the previous calculation period (use in clearing models).

schemeValue.name: MarketQuote
schemeValue.paragraph: The price of an instrument as quoted on an exchange or similar market.

schemeValue.name: ConvexityAdjustment
schemeValue.paragraph: An adjustment to the price of an instrument (such as a future) to compensate for its lack of convexity.

schemeValue.name: AccruedInterest
schemeValue.paragraph: The value of interest accrued from the previous payment to the valuation date.

schemeValue.name: Volatility
schemeValue.paragraph: The underlying price volatility used for calculating the value of this asset.

schemeValue.name: DividendYield
schemeValue.paragraph: The dividend payout ratio, expressed as a decimal (e.g. 0.03 = 3%) per year.

schemeValue.name: CleanNetCurrentMarketPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The price of an asset, expressed in par value, excluding accrued interest, including commissions, as observed on a market.

schemeValue.name: CleanGrossCurrentMarketPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The price of an asset, expressed in par value, excluding accrued interest, excluding commissions, as observed on a market.

schemeValue.name: DirtyNetCurrentMarketPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The price of an asset, expressed in par value, including accrued interest, including commissions, as observed on a market.

schemeValue.name: DirtyGrossCurrentMarketPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The price of an asset, expressed in par value, including accrued interest, excluding commissions, as observed on a market.

schemeValue.name: CleanNetCurrentSettlementPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The price of an asset, expressed in par value, excluding accrued interest, including commissions, for settlement purposes.

schemeValue.name: CleanGrossCurrentSettlementPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The price of an asset, expressed in par value, excluding accrued interest, excluding commissions, for settlement purposes.

schemeValue.name: DirtyNetCurrentSettlementPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The price of an asset, expressed in par value, including accrued interest, including commissions, for settlement purposes.

schemeValue.name: DirtyGrossCurrentSettlementPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The price of an asset, expressed in par value, including accrued interest, excluding commissions, for settlement purposes.

schemeValue.name: CleanNetResetPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The reset price of an asset, expressed in par value, excluding accrued interest, including commissions.

schemeValue.name: CleanGrossResetPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The reset price of an asset, expressed in par value, excluding accrued interest, excluding commissions.

schemeValue.name: DirtyNetResetPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The reset price of an asset, expressed in par value, including accrued interest, including commissions.

schemeValue.name: DirtyGrossResetPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The reset price of an asset, expressed in par value, including accrued interest, excluding commissions.

schemeValue.name: AccruedInterestResetPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The value of interest accrued for price at last Reset.

schemeValue.name: NumberOfUnderlyingSecurities
schemeValue.paragraph: Used for bond positions to report the product of the open units and the par value of the bond.

schemeValue.name: ParallelShiftInterestRateSensitivity
schemeValue.paragraph: Change in NPV/value caused by a parallel shift in the yield curve/risk free rate of interest (IR Delta, rho).

schemeValue.name: BucketedInterestRateSensitivity
schemeValue.paragraph: Change in NPV/value caused by a single point change in the yield curve (IR Delta).

schemeValue.name: BucketedInterestRateConvexity
schemeValue.paragraph: Change in interest rate sensitivity caused by a single point change in the yield curve (IR Gamma).

schemeValue.name: FXSpotSensitivity
schemeValue.paragraph: Change in NPV/value caused by a change in FX spot rate

schemeValue.name: ValuationDateChangeSensitivity
schemeValue.paragraph: Change in NPV/value caused by a change in valuation date (theta).

schemeValue.name: ParallelShiftInterestRateVolatilitySensitivity
schemeValue.paragraph: Change in NPV/value caused by a parallel shift in the volatility matrix (vega).

schemeValue.name: BucketedInterestRateVolatilitySensitivity
schemeValue.paragraph: Change in NPV/value caused by a point change shift in the volatility matrix (vega).

schemeValue.name: ParallelShiftCreditSpreadSensitivity
schemeValue.paragraph: Change in NPV/value caused by a parallel shift in the credit spread.

schemeValue.name: ParallelShiftDefaultProbabilitySensitivity
schemeValue.paragraph: Change in NPV/value caused by a parallel shift in the default probability.

schemeValue.name: ParallelShiftRecoveryRateSensitivity
schemeValue.paragraph: Change in NPV/value caused by a parallel shift in the credit default recovery rate.

schemeValue.name: BucketedCreditSpreadSensitivity
schemeValue.paragraph: Change in NPV/value caused by a point change shift in the credit spread.

schemeValue.name: BucketedDefaultProbabilitySensitivity
schemeValue.paragraph: Change in NPV/value caused by a point change shift in the default probability.

schemeValue.name: BucketedRecoveryRateSensitivity
schemeValue.paragraph: Change in NPV/value caused by a point change shift in the credit default recovery rate.

schemeValue.name: VAR
schemeValue.paragraph: Value at Risk is the amount of money that could be lost over a pre-defined period of time with a a given level of confidence.

schemeValue.name: DE@R
schemeValue.paragraph: VAR for 1 day time horizon and 95% level of confidence

schemeValue.name: EconomicCapital
schemeValue.paragraph: Capital which is kept aside to compensate for unexpected losses due to credit risk. (VAR for 1 year and 99.97%)

schemeValue.name: RegulatoryCapital
schemeValue.paragraph: A provision for expected losses, required by the BIS.

schemeValue.name: ReturnOnEconomicCapital
schemeValue.paragraph: The return from an asset expressed as a percentage of the amount of economic capital involved in holding that asset.

schemeValue.name: ReturnOnRegulatoryCapital
schemeValue.paragraph: The return from an asset expressed as a percentage of the amount of regulatory capital involved in holding that asset.

schemeValue.name: RiskConcentration
schemeValue.paragraph: Measures the amount of risk concentrated in individual counterparties, similar assets, common geographical locations, or common industries.

schemeValue.name: EVA
schemeValue.paragraph: Economic Value Added = (Spread + Fees - Expected loss - Operating cost) -ROE*(Capital at risk)

schemeValue.name: MarginalRisk
schemeValue.paragraph: Change of a portfolio VAR with addition of a specified asset.

schemeValue.name: SharpeRatio
schemeValue.paragraph: The ratio between portfolio return in excess of the risk-free return and portfolio risk (measured as volatility)

schemeValue.name: ModifiedSharpeRatio
schemeValue.paragraph: Sharpe ratio where both return and risk are defined relative to a benchmark portfolio

schemeValue.name: SortinoRatio
schemeValue.paragraph: Similar to Sharpe Ratio but risk defined as downside risk rather than portfolio variance.

schemeValue.name: TreynorRatio
schemeValue.paragraph: Similar to Sharpe Ratio but risk defined as CAPM systematic risk (beta) rather than portfolio variance.

schemeValue.name: CAPMBeta
schemeValue.paragraph: Systematic risk = Ratio of expected return to expected return of the market

schemeValue.name: JensensAlpha
schemeValue.paragraph: The average excess return on a portfolio relative to the excess return predicted by CAPM

schemeValue.name: RAROC
schemeValue.paragraph: Risk adjusted return on capital = (Adjusted income)/(Capital at risk)

schemeValue.name: ROA
schemeValue.paragraph: Return on assets = (Adjusted income)/Assets

schemeValue.name: RORAC
schemeValue.paragraph: Return on risk-adjusted capital = (Adjusted income)/(BIS risk - based capital requirement)

schemeValue.name: PeakExposure
schemeValue.paragraph: The peak/potential exposure of this trade over its lifetime

schemeValue.name: AverageExposure
schemeValue.paragraph: The average exposure of this trade over its lifetime

schemeValue.name: LoanEquivalent
schemeValue.paragraph: The loan equivalent exposure of this asset.

schemeValue.name: AccruedCoupon
schemeValue.paragraph: The coupon accrued on the underlying bonds from that the most recent bond coupon payment date until the valuation date.

schemeValue.name: CurrentNotional
schemeValue.paragraph: The notional in effect on the valuation date.

schemeValue.name: RecoveryRate
schemeValue.paragraph: The estimated amount that a creditor would receive in final satisfaction of the claims on a defaulted credit.

schemeValue.name: CreditSpread
schemeValue.paragraph: The spread between the return of a credit instrument and of a corresponding risk free instrument.

schemeValue.name: EquityAccrual
schemeValue.paragraph: Unrealized profit or loss on an equity price based stream or product. This is based on the difference between current market price and the reset/reference price.

schemeValue.name: RealizedTradingGains
schemeValue.paragraph: Realized profit or loss that has not yet been exchanged. This is based on positions that have been closed out but not settled.

schemeValue.name: FundingOnRealizedGains
schemeValue.paragraph: Funding-related interest charges associated with profit or loss on realized gains that have not yet been exchanged.

schemeValue.name: InterestOnRealizedGains
schemeValue.paragraph: Accrued interest on realized gains, for portfolio swap agreements where unwind profit/loss not exchanged until reset.

schemeValue.name: SettlementFxRate
schemeValue.paragraph: The FX rate used to compute a settlement amount.

schemeValue.name: ImpliedVolatility
schemeValue.paragraph: The implied volatility of the underlying asset from the valuation date to the expiration of the option.

schemeValue.name: CalculatedStrike
schemeValue.paragraph: The effective strike price of the option as derived from the underlying asset swap. (Used for options on asset swaps).

schemeValue.name: RealizedVariance
schemeValue.paragraph: Realized variance between effective date and valuation date.

schemeValue.name: CashEquivalentLocalCurrency
schemeValue.paragraph: The aggregated equivalent FX position in a specific currency. This includes the NPVs payable in that currency, plus equivalent positions generated by trades' price sensitivity to FX rates.

schemeValue.name: CashEquivalent
schemeValue.paragraph: The CashEquivalentLocalCurrency converted to the reporting currency (e.g. USD) at the spot exchange rate.

schemeValue.name: TreatedRate
schemeValue.paragraph: A rate following rate treatment procedures.

schemeValue.name: TransactedNetPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The actual price (inclusive of commissions, when applicable) at which a transaction has been conducted.

schemeValue.name: TransactedGrossPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The price, exclusive of any commission, at which a transaction has been conducted.

schemeValue.name: GrossNPV
schemeValue.paragraph: The gross NPV.

schemeValue.name: GrossNotional
schemeValue.paragraph: The gross notional.

schemeValue.name: LongNotionalPosition
schemeValue.paragraph: The Long Notional Position.

schemeValue.name: ShortNotionalPosition
schemeValue.paragraph: The Short Notional Position.

schemeValue.name: ShortSwapPosition
schemeValue.paragraph: The Short Swap Position.

schemeValue.name: DeltaAdjustedShortSwaptionPosition
schemeValue.paragraph: The Delta Adjusted Short Swaption Position.

schemeValue.name: NonDeltaAdjustedShortSwaptionPosition
schemeValue.paragraph: The Non Delta Adjusted Short Swaption Position.

schemeValue.name: LongSwapPosition
schemeValue.paragraph: The Long Swap Position.

schemeValue.name: DeltaAdjustedLongSwaptionPosition
schemeValue.paragraph: The Delta Adjusted Long Swaption Position.

schemeValue.name: NonDeltaAdjustedLongSwaptionPosition
schemeValue.paragraph: The Non Delta Adjusted Long Swaption Position.

schemeValue.name: StrikePrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The strike price.

schemeValue.name: SettlementPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The settlement price.

schemeValue.name: DeltaFactor
schemeValue.paragraph: The Delta factor.

schemeValue.name: Allocation
schemeValue.paragraph: Process for splitting a trade across accounts.

schemeValue.name: Execution
schemeValue.paragraph: Process for executing a trade.

schemeValue.name: Clearing
schemeValue.paragraph: Process for novating a trade to a central counterparty (with margining) for credit risk mitigation.

schemeValue.name: Confirmation
schemeValue.paragraph: Process for verifying the terms of a trade.

schemeValue.name: Reconciliation
schemeValue.paragraph: Process for comparing representations of a trade or portfolio for the purpose of identifying and resolving discrepancies.

schemeValue.name: Settlement
schemeValue.paragraph: Process for calculating payment amounts and performing payments as required by the terms of a transaction.

schemeValue.name: Premium
schemeValue.paragraph: The premium associated with an OTC contract such as an option or a cap/floor.

schemeValue.name: PrincipalExchange
schemeValue.paragraph: A cash flow which amount typically corresponds to the notional of the contract and that is exchanged between the parties on trade inception and reverted back when the contract is terminated.

schemeValue.name: TerminationFee
schemeValue.paragraph: A cash flow associated with a termination lifecycle event.

schemeValue.name: PartialTerminationFee
schemeValue.paragraph: A cash flow associated with a partial termination lifecycle event.

schemeValue.name: AssignmentFee
schemeValue.paragraph: A cash flow resulting from the assignment of a contract to a new counterparty.

schemeValue.name: Fee
schemeValue.paragraph: A generic term for describing a non-scheduled cashflow that can be associated either with the initial contract, with some later corrections to it (e.g. a correction to the day count fraction that has a cashflow impact) or with some lifecycle events. Fees that are specifically associated with termination and partial termination, increase, amendment, and exercise events are qualified accordingly.

schemeValue.name: Coupon
schemeValue.paragraph: A cash flow corresponding to the periodic accrued interests.

schemeValue.name: InterestReturn
schemeValue.paragraph: A cash flow corresponding to the return of the interest rate portion of a derivative instrument that has different types of underlying assets, such as a total return swap.

schemeValue.name: PriceReturn
schemeValue.paragraph: A cash flow corresponding to the return of the price portion of a derivative instrument that has different types of underlying assets, such as a total return swap.

schemeValue.name: DividendReturn
schemeValue.paragraph: A cash flow corresponding to the synthetic dividend of an equity underlyer asset traded through a derivative instrument.

schemeValue.name: CreditEvent
schemeValue.paragraph: A cashflow resulting from a credit event.

schemeValue.name: IncreaseFee
schemeValue.paragraph: A cash flow associated with an increase lifecycle event.

schemeValue.name: AmendmentFee
schemeValue.paragraph: A cash flow associated with an amendment lifecycle event.

schemeValue.name: ExerciseFee
schemeValue.paragraph: A cash flow associated with an exercise lifecycle event.

schemeValue.name: Principal
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade or trade report represents the information from the perspective of the sender of the report, typically a clearing member firm or dealer (acting as a principal).

schemeValue.name: Counterparty
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade or trade report represents the information from the perspective of the counterparty of the sender of the report, which is typically a clearing member firm or dealer.

schemeValue.name: Agent
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade or trade report represents the information from the perspective of the sender of the report, typically a clearing member firm or dealer (acting as an agent).

schemeValue.name: Customer
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade or trade report represents the information from the perspective of a client opposite the sender of the report, which is typically a clearing member firm or dealer.

schemeValue.name: Clearstream
schemeValue.paragraph: Clearstream International

schemeValue.name: CREST
schemeValue.paragraph: CREST

schemeValue.name: DTCC
schemeValue.paragraph: The Depository Trust and Clearing Corporation

schemeValue.name: Euroclear
schemeValue.paragraph: Euroclear

schemeValue.name: MonteTitoli
schemeValue.paragraph: Monte Titoli SPA

schemeValue.name: Accepted
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade has passed CCP eligibility checks and is accepted as a request for clearing.

schemeValue.name: Cancelled
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade has been cancelled.

schemeValue.name: Decleared
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade has been rescinded from clearing with the CCP.

schemeValue.name: Expired
schemeValue.paragraph: The option trade has been expired (applicable where the CCP is the option executor).

schemeValue.name: Exercised
schemeValue.paragraph: The option trade has been exercised (applicable where the CCP is the option executor).

schemeValue.name: Pending
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade is pending an internal CCP process before registration can be confirmed.

schemeValue.name: AwaitingAcceptance
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade is awaiting approval by a clearing firm/broker before a registration can be confirmed.

schemeValue.name: PendingTheirApproval
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade is awaiting approval by the other clearing firm/broker before a registration can be confirmed.

schemeValue.name: Received
schemeValue.paragraph: The request for a trade to be cleared has been received by the CCP.

schemeValue.name: Registered
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade is registered with the CCP and novation has taken place.

schemeValue.name: Rejected
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade has failed CCP eligibility checks and is rejected as a request for clearing.

schemeValue.name: Settled
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade has been settled (applicable where the CCP initiates settlement).

schemeValue.name: Uncleared
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade has not been cleared and there is no pending clearing operation on it.

schemeValue.name: Fully
schemeValue.paragraph: Both initial margin (independent amount) and variation margin will be posted. For Transparency view, both parties will do this; for Recordkeeping view, this party will do this (a separate indicator in the other partyTradeInformnation block is used for the other side).

schemeValue.name: Partially
schemeValue.paragraph: Variation margin (but not initial margin) will be posted. For Transparency view, both parties will do this; for Recordkeeping view, this party will do this (a separate indicator in the other partyTradeInformnation block is used for the other side).

schemeValue.name: OneWay
schemeValue.paragraph: Applies to Transparency view only. One party will post some form of collateral (initial margin or variation margin.)

schemeValue.name: Uncollateralized
schemeValue.paragraph: No collateral is posted for this trade. In Transparency view, no collateral is posted by either party; in Recordkeeping view, no collateral is posted by the counterparty.

schemeValue.name: NominationDeadline
schemeValue.paragraph: The date by which nomination must be received for a given Delivery Period.

schemeValue.name: First
schemeValue.paragraph: The price will be observed only on the first day (day type is defined in the message) in the Calculation Period.

schemeValue.name: Last
schemeValue.paragraph: The price will be observed only on the last day (day type is defined in the message) in the Calculation Period.

schemeValue.name: Penultimate
schemeValue.paragraph: The price will be observed only on the penultimate day (day type is defined in the message) in the Calculation Period.

schemeValue.name: All
schemeValue.paragraph: The price will be observed on all days (day type is defined in the message) in the Calculation Period.

schemeValue.name: Daily
schemeValue.paragraph: The prevailing FX spot rate will be applied to the observed Commodity Reference Price on each Pricing Date.

schemeValue.name: SpotAtPeriodEnd
schemeValue.paragraph: The prevailing FX spot rate will be applied to the Floating Amount when this is calculated.

schemeValue.name: AverageAtPeriodEnd
schemeValue.paragraph: An average FX rate will be applied to the Floating Amount when this is calculated.

schemeValue.name: FallbackReferenceDealers
schemeValue.paragraph: Fallback Reference Dealers as defined in section 7.5 para (c) subpara (i) of the ISDA 2005 Commodity Derivative definitions.

schemeValue.name: FallbackReferencePrice
schemeValue.paragraph: Fallback Reference Price as defined in section 7.5 para (c) subpara (ii) of the ISDA 2005 Commodity Derivative definitions or section 7.5 para (c) subpara (i) of the ISDA 1993 Commodity Derivative definitions as applicable.

schemeValue.name: NegotiatedFallback
schemeValue.paragraph: Negotiated Fallback as defined in section 7.5 para (c) subpara (iii) of the ISDA 2005 Commodity Derivative definitions or section 7.5 para (c) subpara (ii) of the ISDA 1993 Commodity Derivative definitions as applicable.

schemeValue.name: NoFaultTermination
schemeValue.paragraph: No Fault Termination as defined in section 7.5 para (c) subpara (iv) of the ISDA 2005 Commodity Derivative definitions or section 7.5 para (c) subpara (iii) of the ISDA 1993 Commodity Derivative definitions as applicable.

schemeValue.name: Postponement
schemeValue.paragraph: Postponement as defined in section 7.5 para (c) subpara (v) of the ISDA 2005 Commodity Derivative definitions or section 7.5 para (c) subpara (iv) of the ISDA 1993 Commodity Derivative definitions as applicable.

schemeValue.name: CalculationAgentDetermination
schemeValue.paragraph: Calculation Agent Determination as defined in section 7.5 para (c) subpara (vi) of the ISDA 2005 Commodity Derivative definitions or section 7.5 para (c) subpara (v) of the ISDA 1993 Commodity Derivative definitions as applicable.

schemeValue.name: DelayedPublicationOrAnnouncement
schemeValue.paragraph: Delayed Publication or Announcement as defined in section 7.5 para (c) subpara (vii) of the ISDA 2005 Commodity Derivative definitions.

schemeValue.name: AverageDailyPriceDisruption
schemeValue.paragraph: Average Daily Price Disruption as defined in section 7.5 para (c) subpara (vi) of the ISDA 1993 Commodity Derivative definitions.

schemeValue.name: PriceSourceDisruption
schemeValue.paragraph: Price Source Disruption as defined in section 7.4 para (c) subpara (i) of the ISDA 2005 Commodity Derivative definitions or section 7.4 para (c) subpara (i) of the ISDA 1993 Commodity Derivative definitions as applicable.

schemeValue.name: TradingDisruption
schemeValue.paragraph: Trading Disruption as defined in section 7.4 para (c) subpara (ii) of the ISDA 2005 Commodity Derivative definitions.

schemeValue.name: TradingSuspension
schemeValue.paragraph: Trading Suspension as defined in section 7.4 para (c) subpara (ii) of the ISDA 1993 Commodity Derivative definitions.

schemeValue.name: DisappearanceOfCommodityReferencePrice
schemeValue.paragraph: Disappearance of Commodity Reference Price as defined in section 7.4 para (c) subpara (iii) of the ISDA 2005 Commodity Derivative definitions or section 7.4 para (c) subpara (iii) of the ISDA 1993 Commodity Derivative definitions as applicable.

schemeValue.name: MaterialChangeInFormula
schemeValue.paragraph: Material Change in Formula as defined in section 7.4 para (c) subpara (iv) of the ISDA 2005 Commodity Derivative definitions or section 7.4 para (c) subpara (iv) of the ISDA 1993 Commodity Derivative definitions as applicable.

schemeValue.name: MaterialChangeInContent
schemeValue.paragraph: Material Change in Content as defined in section 7.4 para (c) subpara (v) of the ISDA 2005 Commodity Derivative definitions or section 7.4 para (c) subpara (v) of the ISDA 1993 Commodity Derivative definitions as applicable.

schemeValue.name: TaxDisruption
schemeValue.paragraph: Tax Disruption as defined in section 7.4 para (c) subpara (vi) of the ISDA 2005 Commodity Derivative definitions or section 7.4 para (c) subpara (vii) of the ISDA 1993 Commodity Derivative definitions as applicable.

schemeValue.name: DeMinimisTrading
schemeValue.paragraph: De Minimis Trading as defined in section 7.4 para (c) subpara (vi) of the ISDA 1993 Commodity Derivative definitions.

schemeValue.name: TradingLimitation
schemeValue.paragraph: Trading Limitation as defined in section 7.4 para (c) subpara (viii) of the ISDA 1993 Commodity Derivative definitions.

schemeValue.name: BillOfLading
schemeValue.paragraph: The date on which a Bill of Lading is issued.

schemeValue.name: CompletionOfDischarge
schemeValue.paragraph: The date on which Completion of Discharge occurs.

schemeValue.name: NoticeOfReadiness
schemeValue.paragraph: The date on which a Notice of Readiness is issued.

schemeValue.name: Term
schemeValue.paragraph: The Quantity or Notional Quantity is deemed to apply once over the term of the trade for purposes of calculating the Total Quantity or Total Notional Quantity.

schemeValue.name: PerBusinessDay
schemeValue.paragraph: The Notional Quantity is deemed to apply once per Commodity Business Day for purposes of calculating the Total Notional Quantity.

schemeValue.name: PerCalculationPeriod
schemeValue.paragraph: The Quantity or Notional Quantity is deemed to apply once per Calculation Period for purposes of calculating the Total Quantity or Total Notional Quantity.

schemeValue.name: PerSettlementPeriod
schemeValue.paragraph: The Quantity or Notional Quantity is deemed to apply once per Settlement Period for purposes of calculating the Total Quantity or Total Notional Quantity.

schemeValue.name: PerCalendarDay
schemeValue.paragraph: The Quantity or Notional Quantity is deemed to apply once per Calendar Day for purposes of calculating the Total Quantity or Total Notional Quantity.

schemeValue.name: PerHour
schemeValue.paragraph: The Quantity or Notional Quantity is deemed to apply once per hour for purposes of calculating the Total Quantity or Total Notional Quantity.

schemeValue.name: PerMonth
schemeValue.paragraph: The Notional Quantity is deemed to apply once per Month for purposes of calculating the Total Notional Quantity.

schemeValue.name: Continuous

schemeValue.name: Daily

schemeValue.paragraph: The curve represents annual compounding.

schemeValue.name: Netting
schemeValue.paragraph: Similar trades were combined into a single net trade.

schemeValue.name: PortfolioCompression
schemeValue.paragraph: A large pool of trades was combined into a small number of trades with a similar risk position.

schemeValue.name: Electronic
schemeValue.paragraph: Confirmation via a shared confirmation facility or platform, or a private/bilateral electronic system.

schemeValue.name: NonElectronic
schemeValue.paragraph: Confirmation via a human-reabable written document (possibly transmitted electronically).

schemeValue.name: ACT/ACT.ISDA
schemeValue.paragraph: Per 2006 ISDA Definitions, Section 4.16. Day Count Fraction, paragraph (b) or Annex to the 2000 ISDA Definitions (June 2000 Version), Section 4.16. Day Count Fraction, paragraph (b). Note that going from FpML 2.0 Recommendation to the FpML 3.0 Trial Recommendation the code in FpML 2.0 'ACT/365.ISDA' became 'ACT/ACT.ISDA'.

schemeValue.name: ACT/ACT.ICMA
schemeValue.paragraph: Per 2006 ISDA Definitions, Section 4.16. Day Count Fraction, paragraph (c). This day count fraction code is applicable for transactions booked under the 2006 ISDA Definitions. Transactions under the 2000 ISDA Definitions should use the ACT/ACT.ISMA code instead.

schemeValue.name: ACT/ACT.ISMA
schemeValue.paragraph: The Fixed/Floating Amount will be calculated in accordance with Rule 251 of the statutes, by-laws, rules and recommendations of the International Securities Market Association, as published in April 1999, as applied to straight and convertible bonds issued after December 31, 1998, as though the Fixed/Floating Amount were the interest coupon on such a bond. This day count fraction code is applicable for transactions booked under the 2000 ISDA Definitions. Transactions under the 2006 ISDA Definitions should use the ACT/ACT.ICMA code instead.

schemeValue.name: ACT/ACT.AFB
schemeValue.paragraph: The Fixed/Floating Amount will be calculated in accordance with the "BASE EXACT/EXACT" day count fraction, as defined in the "Definitions Communes plusieurs Additifs Techniques" published by the Association Francaise des Banques in September 1994.

schemeValue.name: ACT/365.FIXED
schemeValue.paragraph: Per 2006 ISDA Definitions, Section 4.16. Day Count Fraction, paragraph (d) or Annex to the 2000 ISDA Definitions (June 2000 Version), Section 4.16. Day Count Fraction, paragraph (c).

schemeValue.name: ACT/360
schemeValue.paragraph: Per 2006 ISDA Definitions, Section 4.16. Day Count Fraction, paragraph (e) or Annex to the 2000 ISDA Definitions (June 2000 Version), Section 4.16. Day Count Fraction, paragraph (d).
Per 2006 ISDA Definitions, Section 4.16. Day Count Fraction, paragraph (f) or Annex to the 2000 ISDA Definitions (June 2000 Version), Section 4.16. Day Count Fraction, paragraph (e).

schemeValue.name: 30E/360
schemeValue.paragraph: Per 2006 ISDA Definitions, Section 4.16. Day Count Fraction, paragraph (g) or Annex to the 2000 ISDA Definitions (June 2000 Version), Section 4.16. Day Count Fraction, paragraph (f). Note that the algorithm defined for this day count fraction has changed between the 2000 ISDA Definitions and 2006 ISDA Definitions. See Introduction to the 2006 ISDA Definitions for further information relating to this change.

schemeValue.name: 30E/360.ISDA
schemeValue.paragraph: Per 2006 ISDA Definitions, Section 4.16. Day Count Fraction, paragraph (h). Note the algorithm for this day count fraction under the 2006 ISDA Definitions is designed to yield the same results in practice as the version of the 30E/360 day count fraction defined in the 2000 ISDA Definitions. See Introduction to the 2006 ISDA Definitions for further information relating to this change.

schemeValue.name: BUS/252
schemeValue.paragraph: The number of Business Days in the Calculation Period or Compounding Period in respect of which payment is being made divided by 252.

schemeValue.name: ACT/365L
schemeValue.paragraph: Per 2006 ISDA Definitions, Section 4.16. Day Count Fraction, paragraph (i).

schemeValue.name: Analytic
schemeValue.paragraph: The derivative is computed analytically, e.g. by a closed form analytical equation.

schemeValue.name: Perturbation
schemeValue.paragraph: The derivative is computed by a numerical difference method, ie. by numerically perturbing the input, recalculating the measure, and dividing by the amount of the perturbation.

schemeValue.name: Substitution
schemeValue.paragraph: The derivative is computed by finite difference based on the substitution of a supplied pricing input, e.g. a bumped yield curve.

schemeValue.name: Numerical
schemeValue.paragraph: The derivative is computed by other (non-perturbative) numerical means, such as a direct output from a numerical model.

schemeValue.name: FirstLienLoan
schemeValue.paragraph: First lien.

schemeValue.name: SecondLienLoan
schemeValue.paragraph: Second lien.

schemeValue.name: ThirdLienLoan
schemeValue.paragraph: Third lien.

schemeValue.name: Unknown
schemeValue.paragraph: It is unknown whether a lien is associated with a loan facility.

schemeValue.name: AgreedInitialPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: Agreed separately between the parties.

schemeValue.name: CalculationAgent
schemeValue.paragraph: Determined by the Calculation Agent.

schemeValue.name: ClosingPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: Official Closing Price.

schemeValue.name: DividendCurrency
schemeValue.paragraph: Determined by the Currency of Equity Dividends.

schemeValue.name: HedgeExecution
schemeValue.paragraph: Determined by the Hedging Party.

schemeValue.name: StrikeDateDetermination
schemeValue.paragraph: Date on which the strike is determined in respect of a forward starting swap.

schemeValue.name: ValuationTime
schemeValue.paragraph: Price determined at valuation time.

schemeValue.name: VWAPPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: Official VWAP Price.

schemeValue.name: SettlementCurrency
schemeValue.paragraph: Settlement Currency.

schemeValue.name: IssuerPaymentCurrency
schemeValue.paragraph: Issuer Payment Currency.

schemeValue.name: AsSpecifiedInMasterConfirmation
schemeValue.paragraph: As specified in Master Confirmation.

schemeValue.name: CancelableProvision
schemeValue.paragraph: The right but not the obligation to terminate a trade early without additional payment.

schemeValue.name: ExtendibleProvision
schemeValue.paragraph: The right but not the obligation to increase the term of a trade (without changing other terms) without additional payment.

schemeValue.name: OptionalEarlyTerminationProvision
schemeValue.paragraph: The right but not the obligation to terminate a trade early with payment of fair market replacement value of the trade by the out of the money counterparty.

schemeValue.name: WesternEuropean
schemeValue.paragraph: Entity Type of Western European.

schemeValue.name: WesternEuropeanInsurance
schemeValue.paragraph: Entity Type of Western European Insurance.

schemeValue.name: EuropeanEmergingMarkets
schemeValue.paragraph: Entity Type of European Emerging Markets.

schemeValue.name: AustralianAndNewZealand
schemeValue.paragraph: Entity Type of Australian and New Zealand.

schemeValue.name: Japanese
schemeValue.paragraph: Entity Type of Japanese.

schemeValue.name: Singaporean
schemeValue.paragraph: Entity Type of Singaporean.

schemeValue.name: Asian
schemeValue.paragraph: Entity Type of Asian.

schemeValue.name: NorthAmericanInvestmentGrade
schemeValue.paragraph: Entity Type of North American Investment Grade.

schemeValue.name: NorthAmericanInsurance
schemeValue.paragraph: Entity Type of North American Insurance.

schemeValue.name: NorthAmericanHighYield
schemeValue.paragraph: Entity Type of North American High Yield.

schemeValue.name: Alleged
schemeValue.paragraph: No corresponding payment (or set of payments) was found in "your" submitted sets.

schemeValue.name: Matched
schemeValue.paragraph: Both sides have the same payment (or set of payments) information within matching policies.

schemeValue.name: Mismatched
schemeValue.paragraph: Both sides have the same payment (or set of payments), but there are differences greater than the acceptable tolerance in the matching policies.

schemeValue.name: Unmatched
schemeValue.paragraph: No corresponding payment (or set of payments) was found in the "other party's" submitted sets.

schemeValue.name: Cancelled
schemeValue.paragraph: One or the other side's values were cancelled.

schemeValue.name: Electronic
schemeValue.paragraph: Execution via electronic execution facility, derivatives contract market, or other electronic message such as an instant message.

schemeValue.name: Voice
schemeValue.paragraph: Execution via a spoken agreement, for example over a telephone call.

schemeValue.name: Written
schemeValue.paragraph: Execution via a written document.

schemeValue.name: SEF
schemeValue.paragraph: Registered Swaps Execution Facility.

schemeValue.name: DCM
schemeValue.paragraph: Registered Designated Contract Market.

schemeValue.name: Off-Facility
schemeValue.paragraph: Bilateral execution between counterparties not pursuant to the rules of a SEF or DCM.

schemeValue.name: Other
schemeValue.paragraph: Risk with no special or mitigating characteristics.

schemeValue.name: TwoComponentIntercommoditySpread
schemeValue.paragraph: Risk generated by a trade based on a spread between two commodities.

schemeValue.name: TwoComponentLocationalBasis
schemeValue.paragraph: Risk generated by a trade based on a basis between a single commodity at different delivery locations.

schemeValue.name: IndexOrBasket
schemeValue.paragraph: Risk that is a component of an overall index or multi-commodity/multi-asset basket.

schemeValue.name: SettlementMatrix
schemeValue.paragraph: The ISDA-published 2000 ISDA Definitions Settlement Matrix for Early Terminations and Swaptions.

schemeValue.name: CreditDerivativesPhysicalSettlementMatrix
schemeValue.paragraph: The ISDA-published Credit Derivatives Physical Settlement Matrix.

schemeValue.name: ABS
schemeValue.paragraph: Asset Backed Security.

schemeValue.name: CDO
schemeValue.paragraph: Collateralized Debt Obligation.

schemeValue.name: CMBS
schemeValue.paragraph: Commercial Mortgage Backed Security.

schemeValue.name: RMBS
schemeValue.paragraph: Residential Mortgage Backed Security.

schemeValue.name: Put
schemeValue.paragraph: The right but not the obligation to sell an asset on predefined terms. The asset may in turn be based on other assets, for example a spread on prices.

schemeValue.name: Call
schemeValue.paragraph: The right but not the obligation to buy an asset on predefined terms. The asset may in turn be based on other assets, for example a spread on prices.

schemeValue.name: Cap
schemeValue.paragraph: The right to receive payments when a rate exceeds a specified level

schemeValue.name: Floor
schemeValue.paragraph: The right to receive payments when a rate is under a specified level

schemeValue.name: ReceiveFixed
schemeValue.paragraph: The right but not the obligation to enter a swap transaction in which the option holder would receive a fixed rate or price. (Also known as a "Receiver" swaption, or "RTR"=Right to Receive swaption.)

schemeValue.name: PayFixed
schemeValue.paragraph: The right but not the obligation to enter a swap transaction in which the option holder would pay a fixed rate or price. (Also known as a "Payer" swaption, or "RTP"=Right to Pay swaption.)

schemeValue.name: Chooser
schemeValue.paragraph: An option in which the option holder has the right to choose which type of option (e.g. a put or a call) the option will be.

schemeValue.name: Collar
schemeValue.paragraph: The right to receive payments based on the amount by which a rate or a price exceeds a specified level coupled with the obligation to make payments if the rate or price is under a (possibly different) level.

schemeValue.name: Straddle
schemeValue.paragraph: The right to receive payments based on the amount by which a rate or a price exceeds a specified level or is under a (possibly different) level

schemeValue.name: Other
schemeValue.paragraph: An option type not otherwise categorizable

schemeValue.name: SwapDealer
schemeValue.paragraph: Registered swap dealer

schemeValue.name: Other
schemeValue.paragraph: Non-SD, Non-MSP

schemeValue.name: Trade
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade is the result of a trade transaction.

schemeValue.name: Allocation
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade results from an allocation.

schemeValue.name: Clearing
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade is the result of a clearing operation.

schemeValue.name: Exercise
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade results from an exercise event.

schemeValue.name: Novation
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade results from a novation event (the terms transfer, assignment are also used in the industry).

schemeValue.name: PartialNovation
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade results from a partial novation event (the terms transfer, assignment are also used in the industry).

schemeValue.name: Netting
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade results from netting.

schemeValue.name: Amendment
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade results from an amendment. (Normally an amendment should be represented directly as an amendment event; this originating event reason is provided to cover the case where a system must cancel and rebook the trade as a result of the amendment.)

schemeValue.name: CreditEvent
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade results from a credit event.

schemeValue.name: PortfolioCompression
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade results from portfolio compression.

schemeValue.name: StrategicRestructuring
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade results from strategic restructuring.

schemeValue.name: SuccessionEventReorganization
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade results from a reorganization succession event.

schemeValue.name: SuccessionEventRenaming
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade results from a renaming succession event.

schemeValue.name: Porting
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade was created as a result of porting. ("Porting" is a type of novation in a cleared environment where the actual parties to the trade don't change, but one of the parties moves to a new clearing firm or account.)

schemeValue.name: AllocationAgent
schemeValue.paragraph: The organization responsible for supplying the allocations for a trade to be allocated to multiple accounts/organizations.

schemeValue.name: ArrangingBroker
schemeValue.paragraph: The organization that arranged the trade, i.e. brought together the counterparties. Synonyms/Alternatives: Inter-dealer broker, agent.

schemeValue.name: ExecutingBroker
schemeValue.paragraph: The (generally sell-side) organization that executed the trade; the price-making party.

schemeValue.name: PrimeBroker
schemeValue.paragraph: The organization that takes on or took on the credit risk for this trade by stepping in between the two economic parties (without a central counterparty clearing mechanism).

schemeValue.name: ClearingFirm
schemeValue.paragraph: Organization that submits the trade to a clearing house on behalf of the principal. Synonyms/alternates: Futures Commission Merchant (FCM), Clearing Broker, Clearing Member Firm.

schemeValue.name: ClearingService
schemeValue.paragraph: The organization that acts as a central counterparty to clear a derivatives contract. This is used to represent the role of Central Counterparties (CCPs) or Derivative Clearing Organanizations (DCOs).

schemeValue.name: Guarantor
schemeValue.paragraph: Organization that backs (guarantees) the credit risk of the trade.

schemeValue.name: Custodian
schemeValue.paragraph: Organization that maintains custody of the asset represented by the trade on behalf of the owner/principal.

schemeValue.name: CreditSupportProvider
schemeValue.paragraph: Organization that enhances the credit of another organization (similar to guarantor, but may not fully guarantee the obligation).

schemeValue.name: Counterparty
schemeValue.paragraph: An economic counterparty to the trade. Synonym: principal.

schemeValue.name: TradeSource
schemeValue.paragraph: The organization that originally supplied the record of the trade.

schemeValue.name: SettlementAgent
schemeValue.paragraph: The organization that makes or receives payments on behalf of the given principal party.

schemeValue.name: Accountant
schemeValue.paragraph: Organization responsible for preparing the accounting for the trade.

schemeValue.name: Beneficiary
schemeValue.paragraph: Organization that suffers the economic benefit of the trade. The beneficiary may be distinct from the principal/counterparty - an example occurs when a hedge fund trades via a prime broker; in this case the principal is the prime broker, but the beneficiary is the hedge fund. This can be represented as a payer/receiver account in the name of the hedge fund, but it is also possible to add the party role of "Beneficiary" at the partyTradeInformation level.

schemeValue.name: ExecutionFacility
schemeValue.paragraph: The facility, exchange, or market where the trade was executed. Synonym: Swap Execution Facility, Designated Contract Market, Execution Venue.

schemeValue.name: TradeRepository
schemeValue.paragraph: An organization that maintains records of the trade for regulatory reporting purposes.

schemeValue.name: ReportingParty
schemeValue.paragraph: The party with the regulatory responsibility to report this trade.

schemeValue.name: TradingManager
schemeValue.paragraph: The entity responsible for managing the assets/investments of this party. Synonnym: Asset Manager, Investment Manager, Trading Advisory.

schemeValue.name: TradingPartner
schemeValue.paragraph: An entity with which this party trades from time to time, ie. with which it acts as a counterparty on some transactions. This role is used for static reference data, not individual transactions.

schemeValue.name: AllPositions
schemeValue.paragraph: All Positions.

schemeValue.name: SomePositions
schemeValue.paragraph: Some Positions.

schemeValue.name: Trader
schemeValue.paragraph: The person executed the trade.

schemeValue.name: Broker
schemeValue.paragraph: The person arranged with a client to execute the trade.

schemeValue.name: Absolute
schemeValue.paragraph: The perturbation is absolute, ie. it is ADDED to the original value.

schemeValue.name: Relative
schemeValue.paragraph: The perturbation is relative, ie. it is MULTIPLIED by the original value.

schemeValue.name: CommitmentIncrease
schemeValue.paragraph: An increase in the commitment level against a particular facility.

schemeValue.name: CommitmentDecrease
schemeValue.paragraph: A decrease in the commitment level against a particular facility.

schemeValue.name: Paydown
schemeValue.paragraph: The repayment of a loan within a given facility, resulting in a decrease of the commitment level of the facility.

schemeValue.name: AssignmentBuy
schemeValue.paragraph: A purchase, by assignment (change in lender of record), of a portion of a facility within the secondary markets.

schemeValue.name: AssignmentSell
schemeValue.paragraph: A sale, by assignment (change in lender of record), of a portion of a facility within the secondary markets.

schemeValue.name: PIKInterestCapitalization
schemeValue.paragraph: The increase of a loan within a facility, due to the borrower requiring further credit in order to cover interest costs.

schemeValue.name: Matched
schemeValue.paragraph: Both sides have the same position information within matching policies.

schemeValue.name: Mismatched
schemeValue.paragraph: Both sides have the same position, but there are differences greater than the acceptable tolerance in the matching policies.

schemeValue.name: Unmatched
schemeValue.paragraph: No corresponding position was found in "the other party's" submitted set.

schemeValue.name: Alleged
schemeValue.paragraph: No corresponding position was found in "your" submitted set.

schemeValue.name: NewTrade
schemeValue.paragraph: Newly created trade.

schemeValue.name: Amendment
schemeValue.paragraph: An existing trade was changed via a negotiated agreement.

schemeValue.name: Termination
schemeValue.paragraph: An existing trade was exited early via a negotiated agreement.

schemeValue.name: Novation
schemeValue.paragraph: An existing trade was transferred to a new counterparty via a negotiated agreement.

schemeValue.name: Exercise
schemeValue.paragraph: An option was invoked and therefore the original option is no longer in effect.

schemeValue.name: Cancellation
schemeValue.paragraph: A trade was removed for reasons other than a negotiated agreement (e.g. reported in error).

schemeValue.name: Increase
schemeValue.paragraph: A trade's notional size was increased via a negotiated agreement.

schemeValue.name: Correction
schemeValue.paragraph: Trade details were adjusted to correct a prior error.

schemeValue.name: NonNegotiatedChange
schemeValue.paragraph: Trade details were adjusted for other reasons, e.g. corporate action.

schemeValue.name: Netting
schemeValue.paragraph: Similar trades were combined for processing simplicity.

schemeValue.name: Price
schemeValue.paragraph: A price, expressed in currency units.

schemeValue.name: ParValueDecimal
schemeValue.paragraph: A price, expressed in percentage of face value as a decimal, e.g. 101.5.

schemeValue.name: ParValueFraction
schemeValue.paragraph: A price, expressed in percentage of face value with fractions, e.g. 101 3/8. Normally used for quoting bonds.

schemeValue.name: Rate
schemeValue.paragraph: A yield (typically an interest rate) expressed as a decimal. I.e. 0.05 means 5%.

schemeValue.name: Discount
schemeValue.paragraph: A discount factor expressed as a decimal, e.g. 0.95.

schemeValue.name: IRFuturesPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: A IMM futures style price, e.g. 9750 is equivalent to 2.5%.

schemeValue.name: ExchangeRate
schemeValue.paragraph: A dimensionless conversion rate, e.g. 1.2. Typically used for FX.

schemeValue.name: LogNormalVolatility
schemeValue.paragraph: A log normal volatility, expressed in %/month [?] .

schemeValue.name: BasisPointValue
schemeValue.paragraph: The value (expressed in currency units) per basis point change in the underlying rate. Typically used for expressing sensitivity to interest rate chages ("IR delta" risk, "rho" risk).

schemeValue.name: BasisPointValuePerBasisPoint
schemeValue.paragraph: The Basis Point Value (BPV) (expressed in currency units per basis point) per basis point change in the underlying rate. Typically used for expressing second order sensitivity to interest rate changes (IR "gamma" risk, "convexity").

schemeValue.name: ValuePerPercent
schemeValue.paragraph: The value (expressed in currency units) per percent change in the underlying rate. Typically used for expressing sensitivity to volatility changes ("vega" risk).

schemeValue.name: ValuePerDay
schemeValue.paragraph: The value (expressed in currency units) for a one day change in a valuation date. Typically used for expressing sensitivity to the passage of time ("theta" risk, "carry", etc.).

schemeValue.name: Shares
schemeValue.paragraph: The number of units of stock. Typically used for expressing sensitivity to equity prices (equity "delta" risk).

schemeValue.name: Therm
schemeValue.paragraph: Therm.

schemeValue.name: DTH
schemeValue.paragraph: Dekatherm.

schemeValue.name: BTU
schemeValue.paragraph: British Thermal Unit.

schemeValue.name: MMBTU
schemeValue.paragraph: Million British Thermal Units.

schemeValue.name: MB
schemeValue.paragraph: Thousand Barrels (BBL).

schemeValue.name: BBL
schemeValue.paragraph: Barrel.

schemeValue.name: CBU
schemeValue.paragraph: Corn Bushel.

schemeValue.name: OBU
schemeValue.paragraph: Oats Bushel.

schemeValue.name: SBU
schemeValue.paragraph: Soybean Bushel.

schemeValue.name: WBU
schemeValue.paragraph: Wheat Bushel.

schemeValue.name: MJ
schemeValue.paragraph: Megajoule.

schemeValue.name: GJ
schemeValue.paragraph: Gigajoule.

schemeValue.name: hL
schemeValue.paragraph: Hectolitre.

schemeValue.name: kL
schemeValue.paragraph: Kilolitre.

schemeValue.name: L
schemeValue.paragraph: Litre.

schemeValue.name: KW
schemeValue.paragraph: Kilowatt.

schemeValue.name: MW
schemeValue.paragraph: Megawatt.

schemeValue.name: GW
schemeValue.paragraph: Gigawatt.

schemeValue.name: KWh
schemeValue.paragraph: Kilowatt-hour.

schemeValue.name: MWh
schemeValue.paragraph: Megawatt-hour.

schemeValue.name: GWh
schemeValue.paragraph: Gigawatt-hour.

schemeValue.name: GAL
schemeValue.paragraph: Gallon.

schemeValue.name: KG
schemeValue.paragraph: Kilogram.

schemeValue.name: LB
schemeValue.paragraph: Pound.

schemeValue.name: MT
schemeValue.paragraph: Metric Tonne.

schemeValue.name: t
schemeValue.paragraph: (Long) Ton.

schemeValue.name: st
schemeValue.paragraph: Short Ton.

schemeValue.name: cwt
schemeValue.paragraph: Hundredweight.

schemeValue.name: Ingot
schemeValue.paragraph: Ingot.

schemeValue.name: ozt
schemeValue.paragraph: Troy Ounce.

schemeValue.name: Day
schemeValue.paragraph: Day (commonly used in Time Charter trades).

schemeValue.name: Allowances
schemeValue.paragraph: Environmental allowance certificates.

schemeValue.name: CDD
schemeValue.paragraph: Cooling Degree Day.

schemeValue.name: CPD
schemeValue.paragraph: Critical Precipitation Day.

schemeValue.name: HDD
schemeValue.paragraph: Heating Degree Day.

schemeValue.name: YieldCurve
schemeValue.paragraph: A representation of the interest rates (yields) at different maturities.

schemeValue.name: CreditCurve
schemeValue.paragraph: A representation of credit pricing at different maturities.

schemeValue.name: FXForecastCurve
schemeValue.paragraph: A representation of forecast FX rates at different maturities.

schemeValue.name: VolatilityMatrix
schemeValue.paragraph: A representation of the volatlity of an asset (in any asset class).

schemeValue.name: AssetPrices
schemeValue.paragraph: A representation of the prices of collection of assets (in any asset class).

schemeValue.name: Time
schemeValue.paragraph: The valuation date or other time input.

schemeValue.name: InterestRateSwap
schemeValue.paragraph: A swap agreement which consists in swapping interest rate streams, whatever the type of interest rate references that are being used (i.e. float vs. float swaps, also known as basis swaps, are included in this category).

schemeValue.name: AssetSwap
schemeValue.paragraph: A swap agreement where one leg mimics the return of the underlying asset. No transfer of asset takes place (sometimes the sale of the bond is included in the "asset swap construct").

schemeValue.name: InflationSwap
schemeValue.paragraph: A swap agreement where one leg references an inflation index while the other one will typically reference a variable interest rate.

schemeValue.name: CrossCurrencySwap
schemeValue.paragraph: An interest rate swap agreement which interest streams are denominated in different currencies.

schemeValue.name: CreditDefaultSwap
schemeValue.paragraph: A swap agreement in which one party pays a periodic fee in return for a contingent payment by the other other party following a credit event on a reference entity, a specific reference obligation or a basket of such reference names.

schemeValue.name: TotalReturnSwap
schemeValue.paragraph: A swap agreement in which one party transfers the economic performance of a reference asset to the other party, typically in the exchange of the financing cost of this asset.

schemeValue.name: VarianceSwap
schemeValue.paragraph: A financial derivative instrument whose price is a function of the variance of the price of the underlyer.

schemeValue.name: CapFloor
schemeValue.paragraph: A contract that guarantees either a maximum (cap) or a minimum (floor) level of a variable inrerest rate reference.

schemeValue.name: FRA
schemeValue.paragraph: Forward Rate Agreement, corresponding to an agreement between parties regarding the level of a variable interest rate at a future date.

schemeValue.name: FxForward
schemeValue.paragraph: An agreement between two parties regarding the future value of a currency exchange rate.

schemeValue.name: FxSwap
schemeValue.paragraph: A financial instrument that corresponds to the combination of an FX spot and an FX forward transactions.

schemeValue.name: EquityOption
schemeValue.paragraph: A contract that gives the buyer of the option the right to exercise it into the equity underlyer (or its cash equivalent) under specified conditions.

schemeValue.name: BondOption
schemeValue.paragraph: A contract that gives the buyer of the option the right to exercise it into the bond underlyer (or its cash equivalent) under specified conditions.

schemeValue.name: FxOption
schemeValue.paragraph: A contract that gives the buyer of the option the right to exercise it into the FX underlyer (or its cash equivalent) under specified conditions.

schemeValue.name: FxSpot
schemeValue.paragraph: A foreign exchange deal that consists of a bilateral contract between a party delivering a certain amount of a currency against receiving a certain amount of another currency from a second counterparty, based on an agreed exchange rate.

schemeValue.name: FxOptionStrategy
schemeValue.paragraph: A transaction consisting of several component transactions, at least one of which is a foreign exchange option transaction.

schemeValue.name: BulletPayment
schemeValue.paragraph: A single known payment between two parties.

schemeValue.name: CreditDefaultIndex
schemeValue.paragraph: A swap agreement in which one party pays a periodic fee in return for a contingent payment by the other party following a credit event on an Index of credit entities.

schemeValue.name: CreditDefaultIndexTranche
schemeValue.paragraph: A swap agreement in which one party pays a periodic fee in return for a contingent payment by the other party following a credit event on a Tranche of an Index of credit entities.

schemeValue.name: CreditDefaultBasket
schemeValue.paragraph: A swap agreement in which one party pays a periodic fee in return for a contingent payment by the other party following a credit event on a basket of credit entities.

schemeValue.name: CreditDefaultBasketTranche
schemeValue.paragraph: A swap agreement in which one party pays a periodic fee in return for a contingent payment by the other party following a credit event on a Tranche of an Index of a basket of credit entities.

schemeValue.name: CreditDefaultOption
schemeValue.paragraph: An option to buy protection (payer option) or sell protection (receiver option) as a credit default swap on a specific reference credit with a specific maturity.

schemeValue.name: EquityForward
schemeValue.paragraph: A contract between two parties regarding the future value of the equity underlyer (or its cash equivalent).

schemeValue.name: InterestRateSwaption
schemeValue.paragraph: An option to enter into an interest rate swap.

schemeValue.name: TermDeposit
schemeValue.paragraph: The simple commoditized term deposit that is typically a trade with a tenor of 1-year or less with no interim interest payments.

schemeValue.name: DividendSwap
schemeValue.paragraph: TBD

schemeValue.name: ConvertibleBondOption
schemeValue.paragraph: An option contract in which the underlying asset is a convertible bond.

schemeValue.name: CommoditySwap
schemeValue.paragraph: A swap agreement in which the payout to at least one counterparty is based on the price of a commodity or the level of a commodity index.

schemeValue.name: CommodityOption
schemeValue.paragraph: An option on a commodity.

schemeValue.name: BullionForward
schemeValue.paragraph: An agreement between two parties to exchange at some fixed future date a given quantity of bullion for a price defined today.

schemeValue.name: FxNonDeliverableForward
schemeValue.paragraph: A cash-settled agreement between two parties regarding the future value of a currency exchange rate.

schemeValue.name: Equals
schemeValue.paragraph: The equals operator.

schemeValue.name: NotEquals
schemeValue.paragraph: The not equals operator.

schemeValue.name: LessThan
schemeValue.paragraph: The less than operator.

schemeValue.name: GreaterThan
schemeValue.paragraph: The greater than operator.

schemeValue.name: Open
schemeValue.paragraph: The quotation represents the beginning of day/market open.

schemeValue.name: Close
schemeValue.paragraph: The quotation represents the end of day/market close.

schemeValue.name: EndOfDay
schemeValue.paragraph: The quotation represents the end of day value as computed during an end of day processing run.

schemeValue.name: High
schemeValue.paragraph: The quotation represents the highest value obtained during the day.

schemeValue.name: Low
schemeValue.paragraph: The quotation represents the lowest value obtained during the day.
Default transport error code.
Transport unavailable.
Unknown recipient/destination.
Delivered to wrong recipient.
Timeout - message delivered past expiration.
This type of message not accepted on this transport.
Message generation problem (e.g. data conversion).
Message corrupted (e.g. CRC failure).
Message text doesn't match digital signature hash.
Default message processing error code.
Lexical problem - not well-formed XML.
Unsupported character set.
Empty or missing content.
Content too large.
System unavailable.
Message component text doesn't match digital signature hash.
Default validation error code.
Unknown or unsupported DTD/Schema.
Unsupported FpML version.
Invalid FpML message - message doesn't validate w.r.t. specified DTD/schema.
Validation failure - unsupported message type.
Validation failure - mandatory FpML rule (a rule we say must always be followed).
Validation failure - master agreement rule (a rule 2 parties agree to follow).
Validation failure - business policy (a rule that only the recipient has).
Validation failure - unsupported product/asset.
Signature required - message content must be signed.
Signature not accepted - problem with message signer (cert revoked, unacceptable principal, etc.).
Default business process error code.
Don't know - unrecognized trade.
Suitability - trade can't be done for client or dealer suitability reasons.
Credit - trade can't be done for credit reasons.
Not interested - recipient chooses not to respond.
Message arrived too late - e.g. trade no longer exists.
Message expired - message arrived on time, but a response was not generated in time.

schemeValue.name: BaseCurrency
schemeValue.paragraph: The currency in which the trade is denominated.

schemeValue.name: QuoteCurrency
schemeValue.paragraph: The currency in which the trade is quoted.

schemeValue.name: SettlementCurrency
schemeValue.paragraph: The currency that the Base Organization is receiving in settlements involving the trade.

schemeValue.name: ReceiveCurrency
schemeValue.paragraph: This is the currency whose increase in value will result in an INCREASE in value to the Base Organization.

schemeValue.name: PayCurrency
schemeValue.paragraph: The currency whose increase in value will result in a DECREASE in value to the Base Organization.

schemeValue.name: PrimaryRiskCurrency
schemeValue.paragraph: The currency that represents the primary risk as seen from the perspective of the Base Organization.

schemeValue.name: UnitCurrency
schemeValue.paragraph: A standardized currency for reporting values within a single unit, such as a legal entity, fund, account, branch, business unit, etc., irrespective of the currency of the trades within the report.

schemeValue.name: ReportCurrency
schemeValue.paragraph: A standard currency used for reporting all values within a report, irrespective of the currency of the trades or units within the report.

schemeValue.name: Snapshot
schemeValue.paragraph: A daily report of the current details for a trade.

schemeValue.name: PrimaryEconomicTerms
schemeValue.paragraph: A report of a new execution that includes full economic terms, typically prior to full confirmation.

schemeValue.name: Confirmation
schemeValue.paragraph: A report of a confirmation of a transaction.

schemeValue.name: RealTimePublic
schemeValue.paragraph: A report that is intended to cover the CFTC part 43 public reporting requirements, or similar requirements from the SEC.

schemeValue.name: None
schemeValue.paragraph: A report that is not intended for further distribution in the specified context. For example, a report that is not intended to be made available to a given supervisory body/regulator in a reporting regime. The recipient is, however, expected to retain the record.

schemeValue.name: DoddFrankAct
schemeValue.paragraph: Dodd-Frank Act (US)

schemeValue.name: HKTR
schemeValue.paragraph: Hong Kong Trade Repository

schemeValue.name: MiFID
schemeValue.paragraph: Markets in Financial Instruments Directive

schemeValue.name: ODRF
schemeValue.paragraph: OTC Derivatives Regulators Forum

schemeValue.name: Originator
schemeValue.paragraph: Originator.

schemeValue.name: Recipient
schemeValue.paragraph: Recipient.

schemeValue.name: Counterparty
schemeValue.paragraph: Counterparty.

schemeValue.name: ReportingParty
schemeValue.paragraph: Party responsible for reporting this transaction.

schemeValue.name: VoluntaryParty
schemeValue.paragraph: Party not responsible for reporting this transaction.

schemeValue.name: Novation
schemeValue.paragraph: A trade is to be novated.

schemeValue.name: Clearing
schemeValue.paragraph: A trade is to be cleared.

schemeValue.name: Porting
schemeValue.paragraph: A trade is to be ported. (moved to a new clearing firm/account).

schemeValue.name: ExpungeRecords
schemeValue.paragraph: Remove all records of the item in question.

schemeValue.name: RetainRecords
schemeValue.paragraph: Retain records of the item in question, but mark it as removed.

schemeValue.name: Confirmation
schemeValue.paragraph: Document describing the legal terms of a transaction.

schemeValue.name: TermSheet
schemeValue.paragraph: Document describing the economic characteristics of a transaction.

schemeValue.name: R
schemeValue.paragraph: Restructuring as defined in the applicable ISDA Credit Derivatives Definitions. (1999 or 2003). Note that the 1999 Restructuring definition can be altered on a bilateral basis with the November 2001 Successor Supplement.

schemeValue.name: ModR
schemeValue.paragraph: 1999 Definitions: Restructuring definition and May 2001 Restructuring supplement apply.Note that the 1999 Restructuring definition can be altered on a bilateral basis with the November 2001 Successor Supplement. 2003 Definitions: Restructuring (Section 4.7) and Restructuring Maturity Limitation and Fully Transferable Obligation (Section 2.32) apply.

schemeValue.name: ModModR
schemeValue.paragraph: 2003 Definitions: Restructuring (Section 4.7) and Modified Restructuring Maturity Limitation and Conditionally Transferable Obligation (Section 2.33) apply.

schemeValue.name: Effective
schemeValue.paragraph: The effective date of the swap leg. This is useful when the information is not directly included in the swap stream (for example, in certain equity swaps).

schemeValue.name: Termination
schemeValue.paragraph: The termination date of the swap leg. This is useful when the information is not directly included in the swap stream (for example, in certain equity swaps).

schemeValue.name: FirstPayment
schemeValue.paragraph: The date of the first payment defined by this asset. The amount of the payment, if known, could be represented by an associated value of measure type "Cash".

schemeValue.name: PreviousPayment
schemeValue.paragraph: The date of the most recent payment defined by this asset prior to the valuation date. The amount of the payment could be represented by an associated value of measure type "Cash".

schemeValue.name: NextPayment
schemeValue.paragraph: The date of the next upcoming payment defined by this asset, on or after the valuation date. The amount of the payment, if known, could be represented by an associated value of measure type "Cash".

schemeValue.name: FinalPayment
schemeValue.paragraph: The date of the final payment defined by this asset. The amount of the payment, if known, could be represented by an associated value of measure type "Cash".

schemeValue.name: PreviousReset
schemeValue.paragraph: The date of the most recent reset in this stream, on or before the valuation date. The reset rate could be represented by an associated value of measure type "MarketQuote" (for an untreated rate), and/or one of measure type "TreatedRate" (for a treated rate).

schemeValue.name: NextReset
schemeValue.paragraph: The date of the next upcoming reset in this stream, after the valuation date.

schemeValue.name: AccrualStart
schemeValue.paragraph: Date interest first starts accruing. In most cases, this will be the effective date.

schemeValue.name: Availability
schemeValue.paragraph: The advisory relates to the availability or service hours of the service.

schemeValue.name: Products
schemeValue.paragraph: The advisory relates to the products offered by the service.

schemeValue.name: Rules
schemeValue.paragraph: The advisory relates to the rules required to use the service.

schemeValue.name: EndOfDay
schemeValue.paragraph: Processing that occurs to close the books at the end of a day.

schemeValue.name: Intraday
schemeValue.paragraph: Processing during the course of a day.

schemeValue.name: ProcessingStarted
schemeValue.paragraph: The event began processing.

schemeValue.name: ProcessingCompleted
schemeValue.paragraph: The event finished processing.

schemeValue.name: Netting
schemeValue.paragraph: Combining similar trades.

schemeValue.name: Reporting
schemeValue.paragraph: Generating reports for the user.

schemeValue.name: Valuation
schemeValue.paragraph: Calculating trade values.

schemeValue.name: Available
schemeValue.paragraph: The service is availalbe for processing.

schemeValue.name: Unavailable
schemeValue.paragraph: The service is not availalbe for processing.

schemeValue.name: Publisher
schemeValue.paragraph: The Settled Entity Matrix published by the Index Publisher.

schemeValue.name: ConfirmationAnnex
schemeValue.paragraph: The Relevant Settled Entity Matrix shall be the list agreed for this purpose by the parties. The list is not included as part of the electronic confirmation.

schemeValue.name: NotApplicable
schemeValue.paragraph: The term is not applicable.

schemeValue.name: Chaps
schemeValue.paragraph: To be settled via Chaps network.

schemeValue.name: ChipsABA
schemeValue.paragraph: To be settled via Chips ABA.

schemeValue.name: ChipsUID
schemeValue.paragraph: To be settled via Chips UID.

schemeValue.name: CLS
schemeValue.paragraph: To be settled via CLS Bank.

schemeValue.name: Fedwire
schemeValue.paragraph: To be settled via U.S. Fedwire.

schemeValue.name: SWIFT
schemeValue.paragraph: To be settled via SWIFT network.

schemeValue.name: DDA
schemeValue.paragraph: To be settled over DDA account.

schemeValue.name: Close
schemeValue.paragraph: Official Closing Price.

schemeValue.name: HedgeExecution
schemeValue.paragraph: Determined by the Hedging Party.

schemeValue.name: Bid
schemeValue.paragraph: The bid price per share on the exchange at the valuation time on the valuation date

schemeValue.name: Offer
schemeValue.paragraph: The offer price per share on the exchange at the valuation time on the valuation date

schemeValue.name: Mid
schemeValue.paragraph: The mid-market price per share on the exchange at the valuation time on the valuation date

schemeValue.name: NASDAQ
schemeValue.paragraph: An amount equal to the arithmetic average of the two prices constituting the Bid/Offer Spread. "Bid/Offer Spread" means the highest bid price per share and the corresponding lowest offer price per share last published prior to or at the expiration time on the expiration date.

schemeValue.name: OfficialClose
schemeValue.paragraph: (i) The published official closing price of the shares on the exchange on the valuation date, or (ii) the official closing level of the index, as published by the index sponsor, on the valuation date

schemeValue.name: OfficialSettlement
schemeValue.paragraph: The official settlement price (however described under the rules of the relevant exchange or its clearing house) on maturity of any of the relevant exchange-traded contracts published by the exchange or its clearing house. For this purpose, exchange-traded contract shall mean a future or listed option contract on the Index whose delivery date is expected to be on the valuation date

schemeValue.name: PrezzoDiRiferimento
schemeValue.paragraph: The official reference price per share quoted by the exchange on the exchange business day immediately prior to the expiration date equal to the weighted average of the last 10% traded volume on the share

schemeValue.name: ARS.BNAR/ARS01
schemeValue.paragraph: The Spot Rate for a Rate Calculation Date will be the Argentine Peso/U.S. Dollar Specified Rate, expressed as the amount of Argentine Pesos per one U.S. Dollar, for settlement on the same day (or, if such day is not a Business Day in New York, for settlement on the first succeeding day that is a Business Day in both Buenos Aires and New York) which appears on the Reuters Screen BNAR Page at the close of business in Buenos Aires on that Rate Calculation Date.

schemeValue.name: ARS.OFFICIAL.RATE/ARS02
schemeValue.paragraph: The Spot Rate for a Rate Calculation Date will be the Argentine Peso/U.S. Dollar offered rate for U.S. Dollars, expressed as the amount of Argentine Pesos per one U.S. Dollar, for settlement on the same day quoted by Banco de la Nacion (in accordance with the Convertibility Law of March 27, 1991 and Regulatory Decree No. 529/91 of April 1, 1991, as may be amended from time to time) for that Rate Calculation Date.

schemeValue.name: ARS.EMTA.INDUSTRY.SURVEY.RATE/ARS03
schemeValue.paragraph: The Spot Rate for a Rate Calculation Date will be the Argentine Peso/U.S. Dollar Specified Rate for U.S. Dollars, expressed as the amount of Argentine Pesos per one U.S. Dollar, for settlement on the same day, as published on EMTA's web site (www.emta.org) at approximately 1:00 p.m. (Buenos Aires time), or as soon thereafter as practicable, on such Rate Calculation Date. The Spot Rate shall be calculated by EMTA (or a service provider EMTA may select in its sole discretion) pursuant to the EMTA ARS Industry Survey Methodology (which means a methodology, dated as of January 2, 2003, as amended from time to time, for a centralized industry-wide survey of financial institutions in Buenos Aires that are active participants in the Argentine Peso/U.S. Dollar spot markets for the purpose of determining the EMTA ARS Industry Survey Rate).

schemeValue.name: ARS.EMTA.INDICATIVE.SURVEY.RATE/ARS04
schemeValue.paragraph: The Spot Rate for a Rate Calculation Date will be the Argentine Peso/U.S. Dollar Specified Rate for U.S. Dollars, expressed as the amount of Argentine Pesos per one U.S. Dollar, for settlement on the same day, as published on EMTA's web site (www.emta.org) at approximately 1:00 p.m. (Buenos Aires time), or as soon thereafter as practicable, on such Rate Calculation Date. The Spot Rate shall be calculated by EMTA (or a service provider EMTA may select in its sole discretion) pursuant to the EMTA ARS Indicative Survey Methodology (which means a methodology, dated as of January 2, 2003, as amended from time to time, for a centralized industry-wide survey of financial institutions that are active participants in the Argentine Peso/U.S. Dollar markets for the purpose of determining the EMTA ARS Indicative Survey Rate).

schemeValue.name: BRL.BRBY/BRL01
schemeValue.paragraph: The Spot Rate for a Rate Calculation Date will be the Brazilian Real/U.S. Dollar Specified Rate, expressed as the amount of Brazilian Reais per one U.S. Dollar, for settlement in two Business Days (where such days are Business Days in both Sao Paulo and New York) which appears on the Reuters Screen BRBY Page under the caption "INTBK FLTING (LAST)" at approximately 11:00 a.m., Sao Paulo time, on that Rate Calculation Date.

schemeValue.name: BRL.OFFICIAL.RATE/BRL02
schemeValue.paragraph: The Spot Rate for a Rate Calculation Date will be the Brazilian Real/U.S. Dollar Specified Rate, expressed as the amount of Brazilian Reais per one U.S. Dollar, for settlement in two Business Days (where such days are Business Days in both Sao Paulo and New York) reported by the Banco Central do Brasil in the "Diario Oficial da Uniao" on the first Business Day following that Rate Calculation Date.

schemeValue.name: BRL.PCOT-COMMERCIAL/BRL03
schemeValue.paragraph: The Spot Rate for a Rate Calculation Date will be the Brazilian Real/U.S. Dollar commercial rate, expressed as the amount of Brazilian Reais per one U.S. Dollar, for settlement in two Business Days (where such days are Business Days in both Sao Paulo and New York) reported by the Banco Central do Brasil on SISBACEN Data System under transaction code PCOT- 390, Option 3, at the Specified Time, if any, on that Rate Calculation Date.

schemeValue.name: BRL.PCOT-FLOATING/BRL04
schemeValue.paragraph: The Spot Rate for a Rate Calculation Date will be the Brazilian Real/U.S. Dollar floating rate, expressed as the amount of Brazilian Reais per one U.S. Dollar, for settlement in two Business Days (where such days are Business Days in both Sao Paulo and New York) reported by the Banco Central do Brasil on SISBACEN Data System under transaction code PCOT- 390, Option 3, at the Specified Time, if any, on that Rate Calculation Date.

schemeValue.name: BRL.PTAX-COMMERCIAL/BRL05
schemeValue.paragraph: The Spot Rate for a Rate Calculation Date will be the Brazilian Real/U.S. Dollar commercial rate, expressed as the amount of Brazilian Reais per one U.S. Dollar, for settlement in two Business Days (where such days are Business Days in both Sao Paulo and New York) reported by the Banco Central do Brasil on SISBACEN Data System under transaction code PTAX- 800 ("Consultas de Cambio" or Exchange Rate Inquiry), Option 5 ("Cotacoes para Contabilidad" or Rates for Accounting Purposes) market type "L" (corresponding to U.S. Dollars traded in the foreign exchange market segment officially denominated "Livre" and commonly known as "Comercial") as of 7:30 p.m., Sao Paulo time, on that Rate Calculation Date.

schemeValue.name: BRL.PTAX-COMMERCIAL.BRFR/BRL06
schemeValue.paragraph: The Spot Rate for a Rate Calculation Date will be the Brazilian Real/U.S. Dollar commercial rate, expressed as the amount of Brazilian Reais per one U.S. Dollar, for settlement in two Business Days (where such days are Business Days in both Sao Paulo and New York) reported by the Banco Central do Brasil which appears on the Reuters Screen BRFR Page at PTAX-800 as of 11:00 a.m., Sao Paulo time, on the first Business Day following that Rate Calculation Date. 23

schemeValue.name: BRL.PTAX-FLOATING/BRL07
